strIntroduction: Discover how the areas of Central and Sheung Wan maintain elements of old combined with new on this guided walking tour of the area Find out how the mix of colonial buildings and futuristic architecture in Central shape the lives of Hong Kong people Share the stories of elderly stallholders and marvel at the variety of produce on sale in Hong Kong's oldest open-air bazaar See Chinese folk religious beliefs in action and hear stories that you won't find in guidebooks Check out how trendy Sheung Wan marries the old and the new Discover Hong Kong facts from your guide on a tour recommended by the Hong Kong Tourism Board Find out how the mix of colonial buildings and futuristic architecture in Central shape the lives of Hong Kong people Share the stories of elderly stallholders and marvel at the variety of produce on sale in Hong Kong's oldest open-air bazaar See Chinese folk religious beliefs in action and hear stories that you won't find in guidebooks Check out how trendy Sheung Wan marries the old and the new Discover Hong Kong facts from your guide on a tour recommended by the Hong Kong Tourism Board What We Love:   What We Love: It's clear from the name - Central lies at the hectic heart of Hong Kong, and it's an unmissable location on any visitor's itinerary. Glittering skyscrapers and grand colonial buildings rest beside each other in harmony, an electric backdrop which defines Hong Kong. Take a short 'ding ding' tram ride to experience the quainter charms of Sheung Wan, a historic and increasingly trendy neighborhood. Find hip boutiques and artisanal bakers yards from atmospheric Chinese temples and traditional trades. Along the way, hear local stories and anecdotes from your guide on this great introductory tour to Hong Kong (it's even been recommended by the Hong Kong Tourism Board!)

Get a feast for the senses on a guided walk around the more traditional parts of Hong Kong in Kowloon Visit a century-old fruit market Soak up the atmosphere of a local art deco-style restaurant Visit Temple Street market and an old-school singing parlour Have your fortune told by one of the area's fortune tellers Visit a century-old fruit market Soak up the atmosphere of a local art deco-style restaurant Visit Temple Street market and an old-school singing parlour Have your fortune told by one of the area's fortune tellers What We Love:   What We Love: For a robust taste of Hong Kong of old, venture over to Kowloon. Experience local Chinese life in the Kowloon heartlands of Yau Ma Tei and Jordan, which are at their buzzing, idiosyncratic best as night falls. Wander the colorful produce at a century-old fruit market where urban tales accompany exotic fruits. Get a feast for the senses at Temple Street night market and pick up a bargain. Find yourself in an old-school singing parlour, a tradition that only lives on in this part of town then settle in for a very local dinner nearby. Have the novel experience to get your fortune told beneath a banyan tree before capping off the night with the unique taste of some more local snacks.

Get a taste for local Hong Kong life on a guided tour of Kowloon's Mong Kok district, seeing local markets, sampling local foods and strolling the bustling streets Ignite your senses at a traditional wet market in Mong Kok Sample Hong Kong's signature milk tea, the infamous stinky tofu and buttery egg tarts Learn interesting facts about Kowloon's history while strolling the many curiously-named streets around Mong Kok See assorted sea creatures being sold in puffy plastic bags, then indulge in natural fragrances at a flower market Discover Hong Kong facts from your guide on a tour recommended by the Hong Kong Tourism Board Ignite your senses at a traditional wet market in Mong Kok Sample Hong Kong's signature milk tea, the infamous stinky tofu and buttery egg tarts Learn interesting facts about Kowloon's history while strolling the many curiously-named streets around Mong Kok See assorted sea creatures being sold in puffy plastic bags, then indulge in natural fragrances at a flower market Discover Hong Kong facts from your guide on a tour recommended by the Hong Kong Tourism Board What We Love:   What We Love: You might find the Mong Kok district of Hong Kong overwhelming, but persevere with the bustling markets, shouts of street sellers and a mix of smells and you'll find a side to Hong Kong at its most fascinating and sensual. Follow your guide to Canton Road market where daily essentials such as religious incense, herbal medicine and dried seafood fill your vision. Experience colourful shopping streets, dedicated to their individual wares such as fish, pets and flowers. Taste favorite Hong Kong snacks like egg tarts and milk tea at a true Hong Kong institution, a 'cha chaan teng' restaurant. All the while your helpful guide will describe the scenes, giving an insight into the local ways of life.

strIntroduction: Climb mountain ridges and hike forest trails on arguably the best hike on Hong Kong Island Hike up mountains for a great alternative view of Hong Kong Island Trek down to the perfect white sands of Tai Long Bay Have a break for swimming or a surfing, or just relax on the beach Hike up mountains for a great alternative view of Hong Kong Island Trek down to the perfect white sands of Tai Long Bay Have a break for swimming or a surfing, or just relax on the beach What We Love:   What We Love: Arguably the most picturesque hike on Hong Kong Island, the Dragon's Back is a classic trail that takes in many of Hong Kong's lesser known surroundings. From mountain ridges and secluded forrest trails, to the white sands of Tai Long Bay, it's no surprise the Dragon's Back trail was named by Time Magazine as Asia's best urban hike. First navigate the dragon-like peak from which the mountain got its name and then descend down to the beautiful white sands of Tai Long Bay where you can have a swim or even sport some surfing. Finish the day's hike by enjoying a nourishing meal and refreshing beverage - the perfect way to cap off an awesome day!

Trek dense jungle and take in Hong Kong's highest and most spectacular waterfall Climb past rural villages and temples Take in the views of the stunning Tai Mo Shan waterfall Hike deep into Hong Kong's spectacular countryside and feel far from the city Transportation included with a pickup at Tai Wo MTR station Climb past rural villages and temples Take in the views of the stunning Tai Mo Shan waterfall Hike deep into Hong Kong's spectacular countryside and feel far from the city Transportation included with a pickup at Tai Wo MTR station What We Love:   What We Love: Nestled within dense jungle on the breathtaking slopes of Tai Mo Shan mountain, lie the Ng Tung Chai Waterfalls. The falls which are the main stop on this 3 hour hike are actually a collection of spectacular falls spread over several kilometres, each more dramatic than the last. The hike finishes at the spectacular 'Main Falls', the highest in Hong Kong. Along the way, climb past rural villages and temples into a world far from Hong Kong as you know it. Hidden within the dense jungle you can uncover some truly stunning places. The city never felt so far away.

Take a full day's hike in the Sai Kung Peninsula discovering unspolit beaches and rising peaks in the most incredible settings Discover untouched beaches and hike some of Hong Kong's most rugged mountains Travel to a part of Hong Kong rarely visited by others Moderate level hike ideal for trekking enthusiasts 5 star 'wildfactor' hike giving you the perfect introduction to beautiful rural Hong Kong Discover untouched beaches and hike some of Hong Kong's most rugged mountains Travel to a part of Hong Kong rarely visited by others Moderate level hike ideal for trekking enthusiasts 5 star 'wildfactor' hike giving you the perfect introduction to beautiful rural Hong Kong What We Love:   What We Love: Arguably the crown jewel of rural Hong Kong, the Sai Kung peninsula is genuinely idyllic and remote offering you the perfect way to escape from the city and experience a different side to Hong Kong. With no roads in sight, the only way to get there is to hike or come by boat. With mountains, waterfalls, beaches, unique rock formations and more, Sai Kung is most unlike the rest of Hong Kong, and is the perfect destination for travelers looking for a more 'off the beaten track' experience.

Take in the incredible sunrise from the gorgeous Lantau Peak and discover Hong Kong hiker's paradise Climb Lantau Peak and catch the amazing sunrise from the summit Choose from two available routes down - both equally as challenging Finish the hike with a visit to the Tian Tan Buddha, an iconic Lantau landmark Ideal for more experienced hikers looking for a challenge Climb Lantau Peak and catch the amazing sunrise from the summit Choose from two available routes down - both equally as challenging Finish the hike with a visit to the Tian Tan Buddha, an iconic Lantau landmark Ideal for more experienced hikers looking for a challenge What We Love:   What We Love: No matter whether you're arriving in Hong Kong for the first time or returning home, the beauty of the Hong Kong's second highest point is lost on few people. Arguably Hong Kong's most challenging summit to climb, Lantau Peak is on of Hong Kong’s toughest peaks, even for serious climbers. Typically beginning around 4:00am, climb up the mountain's north ridge to reach the summit just in time for sunrise. Then, one has a choice of routes down, either returning via the north ridge or tackling the south face finishing with a visit to the Tian Tan Buddha.

With the water by your side, this journey offers incredible scenic views especially of the peaks of the nearby Pat Sin Leng Mountains. A ride for everyone; this flexible route is flat and follows dedicated cycle paths, making it ideal for beginners and youngsters to have a crack at too!

Discover Hong Kong's largest and most beautiful reservoir with a combined cycling and hiking trip around the stunning Plover Cove Hike and cycle in some of Hong Kong's most beautiful landscapes Take in the beauty of Plover Cove - one of the most under populated and pristine parts of Hong Kong Discover secret waterfalls and lush forests Enjoy a crowd free tour led by your knowledgeable local guide Hike and cycle in some of Hong Kong's most beautiful landscapes Take in the beauty of Plover Cove - one of the most under populated and pristine parts of Hong Kong Discover secret waterfalls and lush forests Enjoy a crowd free tour led by your knowledgeable local guide What We Love:   What We Love: Combine two of the greatest ways to explore Hong Kong's wild places and come with us on an action packed adventure! Starting in Tai Mei Tuk, take in the beautiful Plover Cove Reservoir, well known for its glorious hiking and cycling before venturing up it's highlands on foot in search of lush forest landscapes and secret waterfalls. The perfect combination to discover some of Hong Kong's more idyllic spots!

Sightsee Hong Kong aboard an iconic 1920s one hour tram tour then enjoy unlimited tram rides for 2 days - it's a unique way to tour Hong Kong Connect Hong Kong's colorful history with its modern culture on a sightseeing tour aboard a 1920s tram Enjoy a 1 hour sightseeing tour plus 2 days of unlimited rides on the tram network View Hong Kong's most popular sights from the open top upper deck Learn about authentic local life in Hong Kong with a picture gallery, videos and historic commentary in 8 languages Connect Hong Kong's colorful history with its modern culture on a sightseeing tour aboard a 1920s tram Enjoy a 1 hour sightseeing tour plus 2 days of unlimited rides on the tram network View Hong Kong's most popular sights from the open top upper deck Learn about authentic local life in Hong Kong with a picture gallery, videos and historic commentary in 8 languages What We Love:   What We Love: Hop aboard a 1920s style open top tram and embark on a fascinating sightseeing tour through Hong Kong. The city's 'ding dings' (what the locals like to call the trams) are an iconic part of Hong Kong's culture and you'll have the opportunity to experience one of the few trams perfectly preserved in the original style. During the ride you'll encounter bustling streets, modern skyscrapers and famous attractions. The TramOramic Tour is one of the top things to do in Hong Kong for anyone who'd love to get closer to the city's fusion of historic and modern culture.

strIntroduction: Dine on some of Hong Kong's best seafood at the famous Under Bridge Spicy Crab restaurant with a discount meal voucher Indulge in some of Hong Kong's best seafood with a dinner set for 2 or 4 Don't miss the restaurant's signature dish, Under Bridge Spicy Crab, cooked in the special typhoon shelter style sauce Taste a number of other popular dishes including scallops in chilli & black beans, clams with vermicelli & garlic and salt & pepper fish Dine alongside the likes of Anthony Bourdain and other celebs, drawn by the restaurant's stellar reputation Indulge in some of Hong Kong's best seafood with a dinner set for 2 or 4 Indulge in some of Hong Kong's best seafood with a dinner set for 2 or 4 Don't miss the restaurant's signature dish, Under Bridge Spicy Crab, cooked in the special typhoon shelter style sauce Don't miss the restaurant's signature dish, Under Bridge Spicy Crab, cooked in the special typhoon shelter style sauce Taste a number of other popular dishes including scallops in chilli & black beans, clams with vermicelli & garlic and salt & pepper fish Taste a number of other popular dishes including scallops in chilli & black beans, clams with vermicelli & garlic and salt & pepper fish Dine alongside the likes of Anthony Bourdain and other celebs, drawn by the restaurant's stellar reputation Dine alongside the likes of Anthony Bourdain and other celebs, drawn by the restaurant's stellar reputation What We Love:   What We Love: Any seafood lover on a pilgrimage to the foodie Mecca of Hong Kong has probably already heard about Under Bridge Spicy Crab. This Hong Kong institution is famed among locals and travelers alike, all drawn by the world-class crab, prawns, scallops, clams and whole range of other seafood on offer. Don't just take our word for it, the restaurant has seen a number of stars pass through including Anthony Bourdain, Ray Lui, Rosamund Kwan and Rainie Yeung. Each morning, the chef personally goes to select the freshest fish from the local market whilst the rest is flown in from the world's top suppliers. The must try dish? strIntroduction: Day trip from Hong Kong's bustling center to enjoy Ngong Ping 360 cable car, the Big Buddha, Po Lin Monastery and the stilt fishing village of Tai O - complete with local snacks! Enjoy the panoramic ride up to Ngong Ping Village, the Big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery on the NP360 Cable Car Discover the traditional fishing village of Tai O and taste some local foods Take a boat ride around Tai O's stilt houses and to catch sight of the famed pink dolphins Cable car tickets, ferry tickets, coach transfer, English speaking guide services and snacks are all included in the tour Enjoy the panoramic ride up to Ngong Ping Village, the Big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery on the NP360 Cable Car Discover the traditional fishing village of Tai O and taste some local foods Take a boat ride around Tai O's stilt houses and to catch sight of the famed pink dolphins Cable car tickets, ferry tickets, coach transfer, English speaking guide services and snacks are all included in the tour What We Love:   What We Love: If your impression of Hong Kong is towering skyscrapers, hurrying commuters and narrow city streets, prepare to be proved wrong! On this 4 hour tour of Lantau Island, you'll discover Hong Kong's expansive nature, traditional culture and a fishing village hidden in the far reaches of the island. Begin aboard the iconic Ngong Ping 360 cable car for glorious views across Lantau's verdant terrain. At the top, pay a visit to the famous 34 meters Tian Tan Buddha a.k.a 'the Big Buddha' and to tranquil Po Lin Monastery. Making your way down towards the sea and the traditional fishing village of Tai O, hop aboard a boat excursion to understand why the village is sometimes known as the 'Venice of Hong Kong' due to the waterways between the stilt houses and power out to sea in hope of glimpsing one of Tai O's special pink dolphins! Taste some local snacks such as doughnuts, fish balls and tofu pudding, and visit a old-style stilt house, before boarding a ferry back to Tung Chung.

As much as Hong Kong is known for its concrete jungle, the majority of the city's landmass is undeveloped and reserved for country parks and nature reserves. Hong Kong's long and irregular coast comes with many bays, rivers and beaches as well as a Geopark with a UNESCO listing. Visiting all these sites would be impossible for a tourist – unless you view them all from the air! Get an experience like no other when you take in all the wonders of Hong Kong the efficient way – aboard a sightseeing helicopter tour!

Let your culinary skills flourish in this class, as you learn the tricks and techniques to making your own delicious dim sum under the guidance of professional chefs and instructors!

What We Love:   What We Love: Often solely considered as a mecca for dedicated gamblers (the industry is seven times bigger than Las Vegas's after all), the eclectic beauty and European vibe of Macau are not to be missed. As the far-East's first European settlement, Macanese culture is strongly defined by the amalgamation of its Chinese and Portuguese heritage, resulting in the city's fabulous European architecture, delicious fusion foods, and generally far more relaxed vibe than its Hong Kong neighbor. Beyond this, Macau has a wealth of top attractions and UNESCO World Heritage Sites within close proximity to one another. See the top picks on this Macau day tour, including the dramatic façade of the Ruins of St. Paul's, pedestrianized Senado Square, the soaring heights of the Macau Tower and, of course, the city's world-renowned casinos in what is often referred to as ‘the Las Vegas of the East'.

The network of San Luca, Marco Polo and Grand Canals circle within the Venetian Hotel, decorated on either side with impressive facades, quaint bridges and even a cloudy blue sky above you.
